intro: Pimpinella pinetorum, commonly known as the pinehill parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fern-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
